messages.content: How can I install comfy_PoP custom nodes?
To install comfy_PoP custom nodes, navigate to your ComfyUI custom_nodes folder and run the command 'git clone https://github.com/picturesonpictures/comfy_PoP'.
What does the Multiplier Node in comfy_PoP do?

The Multiplier Node in comfy_PoP allows you to multiply the conditioning pooled output by a value. It includes the option to use negative numbers, although the creator suggests sticking to positive values for practical use.
What does the Normalizer Node in comfy_PoP do?
The Normalizer Node in comfy_PoP normalizes the pooled output. It is suggested to play with the node to see its effects as its usefulness has not been fully explored.
How do the Encoder and Decoder Nodes in comfy_PoP work?
The Encoder and Decoder Nodes in comfy_PoP use built-in VAE loaders. If the same model is used in both nodes, the model will only be loaded into memory once. This can save memory.
What is the AdaptiveCannyDetector node in comfy_PoP?
The AdaptiveCannyDetector node in comfy_PoP is an edge detection tool that works quickly. The node provides additional settings not found in comparable nodes and is considered experimental.
The LoraStackLoader_PoP node is a simple node for loading three LoRAs. It includes on/off switches for each LoRA, and model and weight input and output nodes.
The LoraStackLoader10_PoP node is similar to the LoraStackLoader_PoP but allows for loading up to 10 LoRAs. It includes on/off switches and has identical inputs/outputs to the single LoRA loader.
What does the AnyAspectRatio node in comfy_PoP do?

The AnyAspectRatio node in comfy_PoP converts the pixel count of a square image to any aspect ratio desired. It can also adjust the size of the square image and includes a default side length and rounding value recommended for SDXL stability.
